**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-30T15:25:46Z" title="04/30/2015 03:25  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 30, 2015</time> by ManuxKerb**

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/117146-Best-converter-for-*-dds-format?p=1885195&viewfull=1#post1885195](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/117146-Best-converter-for-*-dds-format?p=1885195&viewfull=1#post1885195)

Still experimenting but that's where I'm at with DDS in Paint.NET. Haven't tried GIMP.

Only open with mipmaps if you want to seperately edit mipmaps; generally you won't, you can do fun distance effects occasionally with them but that's usually very specific. If you do open with mipmaps, edit the program & resave with the originals then you've only edited one part of a multi-part image, so that's not what you're after. The "Decode xxxxx" thing is probably fine.

As for saving, if you're modifying an existing file then load it into something that can give you info first like irfanview, and copy that. Generally I would expect simple images to be DXT1 and things with alpha channels to use DXT5.
I've gotten good results by exporting using DXT3 compression with mipmaps enabled.
